content:
Art. 4.189. Provision common to all individual wills
Wills included in this section are signed by the testators and by those who have received them.
If the testator declares that he does not know how to sign or cannot sign, his declaration is mentioned as well as the reason which prevents him from signing.
In cases where the presence of two witnesses is required, the will is signed by at least one of them, and the reason why the other did not sign is mentioned.
